I'd always recommend our favorites for Sushi - Tomo and Nakama really can't compare to any west side Sushi spot  - and we've been too many places.    Sorry Tokyo Lobby - we won't be back.

Tokyo Lobby, after reading some good reviews about this place and some good words of our friends, so me and my family we decide to have dinner here one night 7-16-2011.  We ordered the Kyoto (two people) for me and my husband and our daughter's meal was grilled white fish.  For the drink we had hot tea, Japanese beer, and cup of water.  We don't know why people raving about this place so much.  The fish wasn't fresh and the sushi rice was too mushy above all the Mexican waiter was rude.  We feel like he never had the food here nor experience fresh fishes.  We ask him about the fresh fishes of the day, he told us everything's fresh in cocky way.  We don't know what he's smoking.  The sashimi we had wasn't fresh at all. To us sashimi has to be super fresh raw fishes not couple day old fishes, and the cut of sashimi has to be thinly slices and presentations must be superb.  The presentation of the foods was awful just like the painter don't know how to paint:  "Chef it isn't necessary to put plastic decorations in the boat if it's not edible.  It looks very shabby."   Also this is a restaurant, why was music play so loud like a night club? This place really let us down.  What a waste of time and money coming to this place? We paid our bill and leave with our stomach empty.  Luckily, we drove down the road and saw Fresh Wasabi, so we stop there and try their food.  For the bad night we had at Tokyo Lobby, Fresh Wasabi make up for it.  The food was great and the waitress was outstanding & knowledgeable of her work.  We would definitely check out this place again. Who would have thoughts going out for dinner has to be two restaurants in one night?
Great lunch spot. Quick, cheap, and good. Beef teriyaki is fabulous and the salad dressing is great.

Ever since I received severe food poisoning from Kyoto Bowl sushi I never wanted to eat the stuff again. (Yes, it was a Kyoto Bowl, I know that now. Leave me alone, I was 14!!)   I was introduced to Tokyo Lobby many moons ago by a good friend when I was 18 and working in retail. Tokyo Lobby was still located in the strip mall next to the Wal-Mart and the restaurant was the size of my bedroom. My first taste of Heaven on earth was the Glendale roll! Sweet, sweet sushi! I just couldn't get enough!  The prices were so reasonable and the food quality so well done this was my new favorite place! Any excuse to go here was all I needed!   Then I heard that they were moving! My heart started to drop; was I going to have to say goodbye to my favorite hidden gem? NO! They moved across the parking lot to a bigger better place! Tokyo Lobby is even more amazing now.   Reasons I am giving Tokyo Lobby 5 Stars:  1. I have NEVER gotten sick from the sushi.  2. The prices are AMAZING (I do think they raised them a bit in the past couple of months, but who can blame them?)  3. The new place has more room, a bigger sushi bar and an outdoor patio!  4. The service has ALWAYS, ALWAYS been top notch.  5. They have a yummy Sake selection!

Service here has changed, the past two times I've been its been a bad experience sad to say.   Today they charged me 3.90 for a tea? What ??? Crazy expensive !  They also cleared my table away as soon as I had the last bite, then handed me the check we were there for less than thirty minutes. Normally I wouldn't mind but my husband and I were having a date night and I felt very uncomfortable like we couldn't linger and talk. Also my roll was tiny and had very little fish.  Last time I came I asked for a cucumber wrapped roll and they charged me an additional 3 dollars.   I'm irritated we won't be back
Baby Lobster, Las Vegas Roll and Glendale Roll are amazing and the best I have ever had. If you want sushi, this is the place to get it!

LOVE THIS PLACE! Most tasty, well priced sushi in AZ. Plus, happy hour practically all day. The servers are attentive and all work together to make sure your drinks stay full and your bellies get stuffed with deliciousness. My boyfriend and I usually each get a roll, beers, and dessert for under $30. The Glendale and Mexican rolls are my personal fav but everything is great!

I love to come here for their sushi and happy hour.  I especially enjoy their scorpion roll but so far all their sushi is good. The service seems to vary on our visits but otherwise its definitely our favorite stop for sushi.

I was looking for a good sushi bar and this place popped up. Boy am I glad it did too. Nice cozy place, service was excellent, sushi was amazing, I could not believe how FAST they were! I was actually a little nervous because I didn't think it could be fresh coming out that fast but it was delicious. Also how do you beat 5 dollar sake bombers! thanks Tokyo Lobby, I will be back soon!

You would be hard pressed to tell me there is another Sushi bar in the whole valley that is better than this place! The prices and quality speak for themselves. THEE BEST Las Vegas roll known to man! It will become your favorite Sushi bar after one try! Considering I forgot to check in many times I should have about 10-15 already! :)

I've heard good things about Tokyo Lobby and even tried it once several years ago, only to be unimpressed.  Stopped in again tonight with my daughter and our socks were blown off!  Outstanding rolls were the Aloha, Alaska, Scorpian (spelled according to their menu) and finished it off with the chef's recommendation of the Lolly-Pop roll.  Incredible - to the eyes just as much as to the taste buds.  We both had to force ourselves to stop as our stomachs were certainly enjoying the amazing flavors passing (yes, I realize stomachs don't "taste", but I already referenced taste buds in this paragraph and had to use something).    A bonus was the Blue Fin tuna.   Charlie never knew it could be like this!  We're going back.  Often I presume, and I strongly recommend you do as well.

Kind of a cool joint in an unexpected place.  The appetizers were GREAT! The monkey brains in particular were memorable. The sushi was decent, nothing to write home about, as were the other main dishes.  The service was good. We came with a party of about 12 and they accommodated us right away for an early dinner. When all our rolls came out, it was rather confusing, but everyone eventually got their food.  I would love to come back next time I'm in the neighborhood!

Happy hour is very good! The waitresses were very friendly.  The reason of taking 2 stars off was that the Asian man (hope he is not owner). He asked us whether we are ready to go while we were enjoying the dinner.  He put the check without saying anything. We felt we were NOT welcomed & rushed to get out!

This used to be my favorite go to for west valley sushi but repeat visits have disappointed.  Last week when I arrived with a guest the place was about 25% full and we were told to sit at the small table which is reasonable but I knew we wanted to split the sushi boat ( big wooden boat with sushi and sashimi) which does not fit well in the small tables.  I asked to be seated at a larger table and told they were all taken for reservations.  After I explained why I wanted to sit at one the attitude changed to now allowing me to occupy the table.  Since he was sooooo concerned about loosing business to larger parties we just sat at the small table.  No one ever occupied the large (4 seat tables) while we finished our $90 meal.  I'm pretty easy going but I wont be back based on the attitude of the owner.

Tokyo Lobby serves up the highest quality sushi in this immediate area. I can't eat poor or mediocre sushi and can taste the difference. Since my favorite sushi place changed hands I haven't found edible tuna in the immediate area until my return to Tokyo Lobby. For $2.00 you can order real wasabi sauce here and you can request the Fish Collar that they call Jaw here. I did find that the service was a little hit and miss as the one server never gave me my wasabi but I was able to get it from the other server and in the end I left very happy.  Best sushi in the immediate area that I know of.

I've been trying to eat here for months but only end up getting there on a Sunday which sucks because they are closed on sunday!  Either way I got to go yesterday and it really lived up to the hype!  Playboy roll 1st off is amazing, the freshness and quality is something I've never experienced in the "avenues" ironically good food is usually found in the "streets" ( that's funny to me) but really food was great from the rolls to the miso soup all great.  Another plus is the price which is low for the high quality food you get, this is def in my top 3 sushi places.  Only complaint was the creepy waiter who stood behind us the whole time and wouldn't speak to me he handed both waters to my girlfriend as well as was unable to answer questions about rolls and stuff but was with her which is just odd, food was amazing service needs some work :)

Went in for Lunch and was blown away at the speed I received my sushi, too bad I wasn't on a timetable because I would have been on time.  The food was good and there was a good size crowd for lunch.  Will return for another lunch run.
This a great little sushi bar. Good happy hour and good food. I like to get a sake bomber and some rolls. The Udon  is pretty good as well.

Been here a few times, I guess I go for convenience since its close by.  It's an OK place but I had better.  Service is good and the product is like I said OK.  I've had Mr. Sushi on Black Canyon HWY which is better.

I am a sushi fanatic. I could eat it everyday if I could afford it. It does get expensive. With that said, I have to say that Tokyo Lobby is the best sushi restaurant I have been to. The prices are very fair for sushi. You can go to the VERY expensive places in Scottsdale, spend twice as much, and not get better sushi. I have eaten here more times than I can count and would recommend it to any sushi lover.

The worst customer service on top of mediocre sushi and awful service.  There was a disgusting long black hair I pulled out of my mouth and the manager refuses to do anything about it.  He said "it fell from the air".  Neither person at my table at black hair.  The manager was unprofessional and refused to take responsibility for his servers.  I will never go back.

This is by far the very best sushi in the state! No one does it better and with better flavor anywhere. The couple that owns this restaurant has been doing traditional sushi and Japanese food for a very long time. The specialty rolls are to die for.   Their Albacore is the very best. My favorite roll is the Beauty Roll! It has Albacore, Cucumber in the best Sticky rice you will ever put in your mouth. Try the seaweed salad and squid salad for the best appetizers ever! They also have a killer drink special that has a bottle of hot saki and two large bottles of Kirin Beer. The Sashimi is fresh and you know from the time you enter the door the fish is fresh. They also have a great selection of traditional Japanese food.   I have brought people from Chandler to eat here and now when they want good sushi they make the trip.
great sushi, reasonably priced, and they also offer other entrees as well.  try the grilled whitefish or the teryaki salmon!  One of my favorite places to eat!
A friend and I stopped in for lunch.  The staff was friendly and attentive. We had mostly sashimi. Everything was fresh and very well prepared.  I would highly recommend!

I'm only giving Tokyo Lobby one star because they don't have an option for no stars.. This has been the worst experience I've ever had as far as service. The waitress' waiters and management seem to be in the WORST mood ever and they seem to just not want to deal with anyone. I asked a question about a type of sushi only to have the manager or owner walk away from my table without saying anything to me in response. I am severely disappointed in this place as I have been looking forward to coming here for awhile and I will never come back. Also if you like to watch sports don't come here they don't have any at all..

Love me some Tokyo Lobby!    I've going here for the last two years and its the best.  I didn't want to write a review because I don't want everyone to come and leave me without a seat! :)    But alas, I must share. I love the staff and the rolls are AWESOME! My favorite is the Mexican roll - quite delicious. There has not been a Specialty roll on this menu that I haven't taken a liking to, they taste fresh and the presentation is always on point.    The staff is friendly, quick service and great deals.  The lunch specials deliver a great meal at a great price. The best part about this place is the music!! They love the 80's in here and so I when I'm there, bring it on Billy Idol and Boy George!     I could totally see Glenn taking Julia (from the Wedding Singer) to show off his exotic taste! :)  Its picture perfect.

This place is great whether you like sushi or not. I am not a fish eater, but my boyfriend is. I always order their chicken teriyaki with vegetable tempura and miso soup. All of it is always excellent. My boyfriend orders the California roll (either regular or tempura coated), the spicy tuna roll, and many others. He says it's very good as well. The service is always great and the atmosphere is nice. It's a small place, maybe 15 tables plus the sushi bar. It's not fancy, but it's a nice weekly dining experience that's affordable and great food. Be advised though, they do close from 3-5pm to prepare for dinner service.

This is one of my favorite sushi places. I have been coming here for almost 5 years with friends, my bf, and occasionally, just me.   It's small and cozy on the inside. It's on Bell Road but faces away from the street, in front of Wal Mart.   They offer happy hour during lunch, which is aweome. The rolls featured rotate every so often, and it's always generous choices.   I get miso soup or squid salad with a side of sriracha sometimes, and always sushi rolls. My favorites are the Mexican (crab with sushi shrimp), Philly, spicy crab, Vegas (deep fried goodness) and Yummy roll. (it is!!!) I also get the monkey brains appetizer on occasion. Not the healthiest but its delicious. The rolls are always fresh tasting and they have amazing sauces.   I was with friends once who ordered teriyaki chicken, and that is also delicious for the non sushi people out there.  The owner is often there and always says hello.  I love their iced green tea (as you read my reviews, you'll understand I'm really big on tea). It has to be the quality stuff. So refreshing! Hot green tea is really good, too.  Oh, and they have mochi for dessert! What are you waiting for? Go to Tokyo Lobby!

Very good sushi. The place NEEDS to get bigger, coming here on a Friday or Saturday night is out of the question!!!!!!! Also, more rolls with fruit would be nice... like some kiwi and mango.... the one with tuna and pineapple SO GOOD. :)

Sake bombers for 5 bucks.  5 stars.  Rainbow Roll..decent...  Dragon roll...yuck...Spider Roll ewww.    I've been here several times, trying to like it because of the reviews.  But each time the sushi just sucked for me.  It tasted fishy. And fresh fish actually doesn't taste like fish. Go figure.  And the sweet cinnamony sauce tasted absolutely wretched on the sushi.

Descent lunch hour. Bento boxes offer the most food from the items on the lunch menu but if I were to go here again, I would have just ordered rolls from the happy hour menu. Friend ordered the beef teriyaki which was pretty boring and didn't have any vegetables. Descent option for a quick lunch. I hear Sakana is a better option for lunch.

Just ate here for first time tonight and it was amazing! I have been so homesick for the food back home in Hawaii , been here a month, cured my sickness. The service is great! The pork cutlet delicious, agedashi tofu amazing, gyoza delicious, Poke was huge - so much salad with it, Tuna Roll big and thick, Tuna Nigiri generous size fish, salmon roll huge, heart attack roll amazing, miso delicious, all around HUGE servings, waitress and all staff very attentive.

OKAY. It's official. I went here for lunch yesterday to give this place another try. I don't like to completely write off a place unless I get extremely bad service, but never again Tokyo Lobby! I must be living in crazy town or have the best luck ever going on the two crappiest days for Tokyo Lobby. I'm seriously not understanding what there is to like here.   I ordered a few rolls, one of them were so big in diameter I thought it was a frisbee (not very conducive for dipping or eating for that matter since one bite made everything fall apart) and the sauces on the rolls were way too sweet...I thought maybe they were glazed with candy. And probably the worst roll was one that had too much cream cheese in it! The salmon to cream cheese ratio was out of control! I literally bit into a chunk of cream cheese. I had to drown everything out with wasabi because the water I had tasted weird too. The sad part is I couldn't even finish the meal, not because I was full but because I didn't want to.   The meal was also very overpriced, especially for the quality of food. It's not like I blindly ordered without knowing what I was going to have to pay, but I don't mind paying a bit more for good food -  however this was the nail in the coffin. $45 for a subpar lunch for two people? They can have my money for the last time.
Great place to eat sushi. Always a good experience and friendly staff!  Sushi is fresh and great selection not to mention the good happy hour every day!  Give them a try you won't regret it

Me and some friends had to try this place out because we heard that it's the best sushi in town... When we came in it looked pretty nice and the staff was very friendly. I ordered just a basic California roll and it was surprisingly amazing, and I'm pretty sure my friends enjoyed their food as well. Everything I heard about this place was correct and it really is that good, 5/5!

Consistantly delicious! Have been going to this joint since it was actually in the now renovated WalMart section of this corner. Can not go in without having at least one vegas roll. Their rainbow roll is also a classic and fresh staple. Their Glendale roll is amazing as well!  The cucumber salad is a nice starter. Although it ain't as good as it used to be their miso soup is still pretty darn good! Great sake/beer specials! They also have special rolls for the day; a great place to go have your favorites or try something new!

Huge fan!  I have been here multiple times.  It is a tad on the pricey side, but much better in quality than Kabuki.   They have a pretty solid Happy Hour menu on their roles.   I am a huge fan of their Vegas Roll, yet to find another place make it anywhere near as well.  They have 2 different outdoor patio's available as well.  My favorite sushi place for sure.

When for lunch with kids.  Ordered some Sushi and several rolls (Spider Roll, Beauty Roll, Shrimp Tempura Roll and Spicy Tuna).  Miso soup was watery.  Sushi rice had a strong vinegar after taste.  Service was good.  Overall, a little pricey for average Sushi.

Craving some sushi, I got a chance to go to Tokyo Lobby for the first time the other night.  After reading a few of my fellow Yelper's reviews on this place I was excited to find good sushi and sashimi on the West Side ~ in Glendale of all places!  To my amazement and bewilderment Tokyo Lobby serves some of the freshest and most delicious sushi I've had in the Phoenix metro including Scottsdale!  Wowsers! Why did it take me so long to find this place? Well it's a tiny place joined to a shoe store located in front of the "super-duper-take-your-money-and-run-Walmart-center" at 57th & Bell.  Since I hate shopping at "wally world" I have been driving past them for months not knowing about this little gem of a sushi restaurant.   I sat at the sushi bar where I could have a better view of the sushi maestro Kelvin Kim create the most wonderful sushi concoctions. The restaurant is very clean and nicely decorated with Asian art and a few TV's to watch the games. The sushi bar is the main attraction with Chef Kim and another sushi master working their magic.  The service was top notch, very accommodating and eager to please their customers.  Food: Started with Hamachi Belly sashimi ~ very tasty, sweetest tasting tuna ever.  I ordered some fresh wasabi and ponzu sauce to go with my sushi rolls. I ordered the "what the heck" ~ nice punch of heat with great texture from the tuna and jalape√±os and the Chicago roll ~ great blend of spicy crab/scallops with salmon.  Both were unique and outstanding!  Topped it all with a $5 sake bomb special ~ large Ichiban beer with hot sake.  "make it a double sake bomb pleeeeaaasseee!"   Huge THANKS to my fellow Yelper's for recommending this little sushi gem! I am looking forward to my next visit and trying another one of Chef Kim's sushi creations. I recommend you try Tokyo Lobby next time your craving for sushi and hope to see you there!

Liked this place so much the first time I came for dinner on a second day in a row. It seems like it's always very dark inside, but in case you want more light they are 2 patios outside. On my first dinner I ordered from the Happy Hour menu, all of the items on which looked great. The second day I got one of the bento boxes, which turned out to be a lot of food but it was so delicious I was able to finish it all. The only issue I could see someone having with this place is the fact that it's fairly dark inside, but I personally didn't have a problem with it, it'd probably be a nice place to bring someone on a date, as I saw a decent amount of couples there when I went for dinner on both days. I will definitely come back when I return to Phoenix in the future.

Very good sushi place. Staff is polite and attentive i always have s great experience when I come here, the food on the other hand is delicious !!!! They have a variety of options you can choose from that vary in cooked and raw.

Didn't get a chance to try the food, the waitress was so rude from the minute we walked in.  After we ordered our drinks she was still being rude so we decided to leave. It wasn't just us who walked out either, there was a couple who came in right after us who left too!

Very nice lunch.  Tempura udon was very flavorful and tempura nice and crisp.  Was made to order so a bit of a wait.  Wife had a sushi combo which was also very nice will try again in evening.  Looks like most help is Japanese
Solid sushi great happy hour pricing. The service sometimes can appear like they are angry at the guest for some reason or another all and all quality food keeps us coming back.
Definitely will visit again. The service and the rolls were excellent. I've been to a few different sushi restaurants and this one is by far the best one.

I feel awkward giving this restrauant the lowest score it's received but I came here based on Yelp! reviews.  The rolls were all specialty rolls so I went crazy and ordered 5 of them. The heart attack roll was weak and the jalepenos were not stuffed at all... The fire and volcano rolls which are supposed to be baked came out cold and tasted extremely bland... And the Mama Mia roll was somewhat decent.  It's a small place and although we got there later in the night I did not expect to be stared at to finish and feel uncomfortable with 10 minutes until close still while they turned all lights off.   I won't be going back.

I don't know what people are talking about when they criticize the staff for being rude or the food for being 'bland' or 'tasteless.' I have been to this little sushi place twice and I've experienced nothing negative. In fact, I found the staff quite friendly and welcoming. The sushi chefs stop to enthusiastically greet each customer who walks through the door. Waitresses promptly seat you and take your drink order. I do find it a little weird that they only provide one menu per table, which might be logistically challenging if you have a large group of people. Maybe in that case they bring you two. So far that hasn't been an issue for me since I tend to order from the sushi menu a la carte.   I found the sushi itself to be pretty darned good; not stellar, but pretty tasty. If I were to rate just the quality of the food, I'd give it a solid 7. They have a fairly decent assortment of specialty rolls, which is what I like in a sushi place. I prefer variety and creativity, over the norm. I hate sitting down to sushi only to find the menu selections to be the standard caterpillar, California and dragon rolls. Boooooooor-ing!   To sum up my experience... The sushi was well prepared, tasty and fresh. The staff was friendly and the food came out quickly. Prices are moderate. Overall, I'm happy!   So, would I recommend this place? Absolutely! Will I come back? You betcha! Just save me a seat.

Tokyo lobby is an overall good choice. The fish is fresh and basically nothing else on the menu has every disappointed me.   Having said that there are some things that I'm gonna complain about.....I can't give it 5 stars because 1. Service blows- If you're planning on having dinner there on the weekend, don't. I swear they have maybe two waitresses who are running around all over the place. They need to hire more people. 2. It's expensive- I like to get sashimi and the prices are outrageous.   I guess I'll give them some compliments since I just tore them a new a-hole. Go for lunch-it's way worth it. The lunch menu is cheap and really good, there aren't too many people there so the service is good and the staff is really friendly.

I'm relatively new to sushi and I felt that this was a very welcoming environment for newcomers. My favorites, avocado and California rolls, were amazing and the new ones I tried, Las Vegas and Sex-on-the-beach were delicious. So glad I came here!
Best sushi in town!!! Great service and food. Have been here numerous times and never a disappointment.
Excellent food. ..great price. .. specially during happy hour after 8:pm.   The Mexican roll is my favorite.

We went here last night, and it was absolutely amazing. We thought we would try a new place and we are glad we did! The sushi was amazing! The service was awesome! They were so attentive but not over top so that you were annoyed. Love this place!!

My favorite here is Alaskan roll and Boston roll. Service is great every time, never have to remind them for something you asked. They never messed up on our orders. Always on point. We been here over 20 times in the past 10 years. I would highly recommend this place. Just don't go on Saturdays nights lol that's our day and we always go with a party 8+. Kidding.
Love this place, great food. Great happy hour. It is my top pick for sushi!
For a NYC guy visiting Phoenix for the first time, i gotta say i was imressed. Try the unagi or spicy tuna. Both are excellent.

One of the worst sushi joints I have been a patron of.  Very crowded, noisy, rushed, and the sushi just isn't that good... bland, nothing special, doesn't even look good. No Wow factor here.  on top of that, it's not a cheap spot to go to. $$-$$$ based on your mood. Stay away from Phili rolls here.
This is my go to spot for sushi in the west valley and with never ending happy hour, I make the trip often. So good!

Tokyo lobby is just OK.  We went around 8pm on a Saturday, there was no wait, but it was close to full. The portion sizes are good and they have some interesting rolls that I'd never seen before, like the "what the heck" roll, which is pretty spicy and pretty good.  I am a seaweed salad junkie. Unfortunately here its lacking, the seaweed was really hard and tough, instead of a crisp/squishy texture that it usually has. It was really disappointing because I think its a pretty hard thing to mess up. I also got a spicy tuna roll, which was not good. It tasted like nothing. Not spicy, or any other flavor at all. It was really weird and I ended up just not eating it which is UNHEARD of when it comes to me and sushi.  I think that my boyfriend would probably come back here because their nigiri and specialty rolls are pretty good, but I need my seaweed salad fix when I get sushi, so I don't think I'll be going back. The prices are what I consider average.

Found this place by chance, since it's a little out of my usual stomping grounds. We stopped in for lunch, and I'm a little bit in love with the place. It's kind of dark inside, with a classic rock station on the radio. It's family friendly. The next table over was a man and three kids, and they greeted some apparent regulars by name when they came in, so is the kind of atmosphere I love.  We ordered bento boxes and they were HUGE. We probably didn't eat half the food. I had the chicken, but I'll admit that I liked my roommate's steak better. Everything was tasty and seemed fresh.  Bottom line: 10/10, would nom it again.

Tonight was the third time I have gone there and have to say third time was the charm...Love this place.  Great service, food, timely service and nice atmosphere a big win!!!  All though it is a little small and you may need to wait...but if that is the case and you are flexible they do to go orders and take reservations.  Happy hour offers some great deals for you.

I've been coming here for years. Personally, I feel like they're slipping. They use mayo in their crab mix and their spicy tuna. Their fish doesn't seem as fresh as it used to be, and the owner just doesn't seem like a people person. The waitresses and chefs are very kind but the owner tends to be impatient. Every time I eat here now I get a weird itch in my throat and I can't tell if it's all the mayo they use or their fish. Sadly disappointed.

This place is solid.  Not amazing, but solid.  Its actually owned by a Korean family and not a Japanese family - and you'll notice it in the details but overall we had a good experience here.   We ordered a lot of things which ranged in flavor and quality.  Here is the skinny... Rice:fish ratio (sushi only) - perfect Fish quality - ok to excellent; salmon and yellowtail were ok - yellowtail belly, large scallops and  mirugai were excellent.   Rolls were ok  - we had two specialty rolls; most of them come as "spicy" which I personally don't enjoy.  Tempura veggies:  excellent.  The service was great.  The restaurant was clean...will most likely become our new neighborhood sushi joint.  Glad to have found this place with the help of my fellow yelpers.

this is by far my favorite sushi place here in the valley! i would usually come here after work and the staff is so friendly and attentive. the service is quick and the sushi wins me over every time. highly recommend the chef specialty rolls, especially the orgasm roll! dont pass up this small sushi joint, one visit is all it took for me to be hungry for more!

I'm not a big sushi fan but a close friend of mine swears by this place and so I gave it a try (I was elated that the Yelp reviews were all wonderful, as well).  I was pleasantly surprised.  I had a hot house Sake carafe- of course it did not disappoint.  We had the monkey brains to start out with as an appetizer- it was delicious.  It was a fried piece of heaven with spicy tuna and mushrooms.  They also have an appetizer called the heart attack which I will have to go back to try (jalapenos stuffed with yummy cream cheese).  I had a miso soup and the spicy tuna roll which I was quite happy with.    The service was decent, although the Lakers seemed to be quite a distraction for our server.  A great place for my first open minded sushi experience.

This is by far our favorite sushi place... we've been to many, but the value and freshness you receive here is outstanding. Plus, it's always fast, which we love! All we order are rolls and nothing we've tried is bad.

The sushi here is exceptional. My friend, Mason P., and I went here for lunch today because we were in a sushi mood.  We ordered the Vegas Roll, the Hawaiian roll, and the Chicago roll. The last of which was not my favorite thing in the world because it was pretty bland. On the other hand, the Vegas and the Hawaiian rolls were both great.  One major complaint that I have... I want a straw with my beverage next time, please. Another thing, the staff is nice, but not really personable. It was pretty busy, though.

My boyfriend and I decided to try this place because Island Teriyaki across the street was closed. We got there and were served very quickly. As I was looking at the menu a gnat or other small bug landed on me.. Kinda freaked me out. Also,an open trash can right by the door to the back of the kitchen/cleaning area in plain view of customers, right by the sushi making area. We ordered and I got the chicken teriyaki and he got the beef teriyaki. The food came out hot and looked pretty great. Upon closer inspection I noticed my chicken just looked..off. Maybe because I'm used to white, juicy chicken at Island Teriyaki. Maybe it was the lighting? I don't know but after eating just not very impressed. Had almost no flavor, like not marinated long enough. I got siracha to put on it and some soy sauce for more flavor and I like spicy anyways. I tried my boyfriend's beef teriyaki and it just tasted much better and not overcooked and flavorless. Giving three stars for fast service and the price wasn't too expensive, $25 on a Sunday night for 2 entrees a beer and a soda.   I would rather have Island Teriyaki across the street , the spicy chicken there is phenomenal and cheaper for the same amount of portions.

"I've cut a bitch for less..."  This is the response I received from my Partner in Culinary Crime after demonstrating my mad chopstick skills to scoop up a wayward spicy scallop.   You see, the creations at Tokyo Lobby are worth fighting for.  Every last morsel.  Of course I am going to risk life and limb!!   :)  Before moving AZ, I was told by friends who were familiar with my sushi-loving ways that I had to try Tokyo Lobby.  Nearly two years later, it was finally time to take their advice - we headed west into the uncharted territory of... Glendale!  That first visit was spectacular, and since then we have been back multiple times for both lunch and dinner.  Sometimes twice in the same week - it is really that good.   We have tried a variety of items, but so far the favorites are:  - Hamachi Toro - yellowtail belly sashimi - Spicy Scallops - Chicago Roll - salmon on spicy crab and scallops - What the Heck Roll - I can only describe this as spicy tuna heaven, with some jalapeno tossed in just because it is fun...  Try any and all of these with their fresh wasabi and citrus-infused ponzu.  Amazing!!  Top this off with a large beer (Ichiban, please!) and hot sake for only $5.  From the fresh and perfectly prepared fish to the friendly and attentive owners and staff, a visit to Tokyo Lobby is really a pleasure.  If Glendale is not what immediately comes to mind when you think of sushi, it will be soon!    Tanoshinde!!

Okay, we've been here several times, our first experience was great, great service and great sushi. We love coming here. A couple of weeks ago, my husband and I went there alone without our kids, date night. The waiter was a little rude about how much sushi we were ordering. You know date night goes, we like to splurge a little when it comes to food. So, we order a couple of different types of sushi rolls, some we haven't tried. And he was surprised on how much we were eating. We aren't overweight or anything. We just wanted to try different types of rolls. It would be a little nice to not be judged on the amount of food that is being ordered. And we felt like we were being rushed. Don't get me wrong it is a small restaurant. But if you're paying for a meal it would be nice to at least enjoy without being rushed. This is the only problem I've had with this place. So, enough about that. They have $5 sake bombers during happy hour, which is awesome but not really a fan of Kirin. I wish they had Sapporo. Again, the sushi is great. I will definitely come back, but hope to have a better experience like I did the first time.

My daughter and I came in for dinner, we ordered the Kyoto boat, it was wonderful, very fresh sushi beautifully arranged. We also ordered seaweed salad and potato croquettes. Everything was delicious. Our server was friendly and attentive, Tokyo Lobby will definitely be one of our favorite places for sushi!

It's been a few months since I first tried Tokyo Lobby, so I will do my best to remember the highlights. It's a bit out of my way so I've only yet to go one time. But I could only take so much nagging and prodding and pushing from my coworker who kept whining "I want Tokyo Lobby!" until I finally said "OK SHUT UP WE ARE GOING THIS INSTANT"  The thing that stood out the most was the friendly staff. When my friends and I walked in, the employees all greeted us with a friendly shout. Suddenly I'm Norm from "Cheers"  The sushi was excellent! I'm still kind of a sushi noob, but as a person who doesn't really care for fish I have to say it was quite impressive. The texture was just right; not too chewy and not too squishy.  I believe what I had was called a Glendale Roll. Baby lobster and... stuff, rolled up, battered and fried to a crisp. Delicious! Nothing like good sushi cooked to order! (Yes, it's ironic on purpose) I think all food should be battered and fried. If you see a restaurant in the future called The Battery, then odds are I'll be running the place.  At the time of my last visit, there was a new location being built closer to the road on the opposite end of the parking lot. I'm assuming this is to accomodate more customers as Tokyo Lobby was teeny tiny inside. Maybe it's to further distance the restaurant from the WalMart a few doors down. I say good on you, Tokyo Lobby. WalMart sucks. As of right now I don't know if it's open yet, but hopefully it will be soon. Excellent place, and I would recommend it to anyone with an appetite for sushi.  Edit! I asked my coworker today about the status of the new building and he says it's open! I like exclamation points!

My first time here and as I'm sitting in my seat inside I was thinking how I was going to love this place. But I didn't. Granted I came in 45 min before they close I instantly felt not welcomed. Then the prices sucked. I thought it was happy hour. Then the food came but the food sucked yen is way better my dragon roll look like a snail world. Then to top it off they took forever to give us our tab. While I was waiting for my tab I got the pleasure of sharing my f****** drink with a flying visitor then finally my tab came only to go over it and realize that because we ordered a side of rice and a roll the sake bomber was $10 because the rice didn't amount to $10 of food so the happy hour special is only if you order $10 of food per person to get a $5 sake bomber needless to say this is probably one of the worst dining experiences I've had in about a good ten years I love sushi but I don't love Tokyo Lobby!!!!!!!
Place was very clean with extremely good service!!!!  Fresh fish and great quality.  Will be back again.
Best udon noodles ever, also very good sushi but I go there mostly for the tempura udon. Good staff, good quality and quantity of food.

I love this little place!  Everyone is always so friendly. Fast service, too. My advice is to stick to the nigiri/sashimi, or look for single-ingredient rolls. The Philly roll is good, too. Most of the specialty rolls are drowned in spicy mayo or Sriracha, and the taste of the fish is overwhelmed.

Lali J. and I took a road trip to Tokyo Lobby last night. We'd heard about it through excellent reviews in the New Times and the Republic (a positive review in the Republic is often a neon sign that says "stay away," but we decided to risk it).   As a transplanted New Yorker/San Franciscan/Los Angeleno, I have to say Tokyo Lobby has been my favorite sushi experience in the valley. If you're used to Ra or any of the other McSushi places, it's worth the schlep up to North Glendale (which is almost as far as the Yukon from where we live) to check this place out.  T.L. is a small, 10 table joint, but it's crowded in a vibrant, fun way. Service is fast and friendly. It's in a strip mall, but if you keep your eyes left of center as you approach from the parking lot, you won't see the WalMart on your right.   The usual/traditional suspects are brilliant -- stunning unagi, maguro, tobiko, etc. The sides and appetizers were fab, too: great seaweed salad and gyoza.   Tokyo Lobby is creative with the specialty rolls -- the Marilyn Mon-Roll (not kidding) was terrific: a spicy tuna roll wrapped in albacore with an elegant topping of crispy/crunchy onion.  There's also a full menu of earthbound flesh and assorted other goodies. Everything looked great. Really -- check this place out!
If the outside of the building was nicer, I'd probably view this Japanese Restaurant as a a high end place.  Excellent service and even better sushi/food.  Best Japanese food in the PHX market.

We love coming here! This is actually our only sushi place. We love sitting at regular counter  and have gotten to know quite a few people. We actually got a plate when the owner (he was making sushi) made us something on the house. Service is great and attentive. In 5 years never had a complaint!

This is our other go to place for sushi. The garlic ponzu sauce they use on the playboy and playgirl rolls is to die for. The server always remembers us and brings our usual drinks. Always a nice touch when you get personalized service. Although they don't usually have any sashimi specials, the sashimi is always fresh and the rolls are very creative and delicious!

I just moved from Seattle back in December and I am no slouch when it comes to Good fresh sushi. The Tokyo Lobby is all of that and more. Excellent sashimi and sushi, great bento box options that the whole family can enjoy. My family and I have been here about four times in the last six months and plan on returning again and again, as long as the quality and service continues to be top notch. I work hard for my money and I have no qualms spending it in a place like this!

Been going since they moved locations. This is my buddies favorite spot to go. He's been going with his entire family since his kids where in diapers. I Love this place almost as much as another favorite of mine. I like everything but Salmon so if you're adventurous you can try pretty much anything. I had my first Tuna Sashmi here. It was excellent. Sat at the sushi bar, The Sushi Chief is great I'm old so I forget his name. Yeah I dig this place.

First of all, can I start with how much I adorable this place! Every time we go in everyone is so amazing, smiling, and gracious! You need something just ask, I had a friend who couldn't use chopsticks so they brought her "training chopsticks". They are passionate about their restaurant as well, best of all it's locally owned! You can't beat this place, they display of their sushi, their customer service, it's the whole "enchilada"!! Definitely one of my favorite places to have sushi around the valley!

Worst sushi I've ever had. I got it to go, otherwise I would have sent it back. The wasabi smelled strange and the Vegas roll was mushy, cold, and stale. I only ate a couple pieces and threw the rest away. I had another roll that was supposed to have spicy tuna and tempura. It was also mushy and there was nothing spicy about. I smelled a piece and it smelled straight up funky. I love sushi but this stuff turned my stomach.

I've ordered sushi for pick up a few times and have eaten inside the restaurant once. Every time I've ordered sushi for pick up it's always tasted amazing. Eating inside the restaurant was not a good experience. Our waitress was unfriendly and seemed like she was in a bad mood. She almost made us feel as if we were bothering her. The sushi also didn't taste as good as it does when I order pick up. I'll give it another try but I definitely won't be eating inside anytime soon.

TL is a terrific Sushi restaurant. They're busy enough to ensure fresh sushi every time. We always get started with the Monkey Brains (spicy crab inside a tempura mushroom).  Seems like every time we get it the sushi chef puts a little different spin on the presentation. Always worth the price of admission. Skyler must have hit TL on an extraordinarily rare off day to pan this place. We've dined here probably 30+ times and never had a bad meal.  We're not stuck on any other roll, there are so many to pick from on the menu. We do like to sit at the bar and watch the chefs work.  We drive past quite a few sushi places to eat at Tokyo Lobby.

After a photoshoot in Tempe my friends and I wanted some goooood sushi. We were headed to Glendale so decided to look up some places up there. We decided on Tokyo Lobby. TL was very easy to find; you enter the plaza and its right as you drive in. There is a small parking lot for this small sushi place. They have two patio areas. On the inside, they have a small set up of tables. They definitely had enough seating areas for groups of six or more so thats a plus for big groups. You get the traditional greeting as you walk in. The service was great! They were nice and quick. The sushi prices were reasonable. They were actually proper sized bites where you don't need to take two bites to finish the whole thing.  We ordered las vegas rolls, spicy tuna, scorpion roll, california roll, shrimp tempura, musashi roll, and fresh wasabi. I enjoyed the way they made their rolls and the quantity for the price. 8 rolls for about $6. Everyday is happy hour so they have rolls starting at $4. I will definitely come back to Tokyo Lobby!
Been her just once and had a good experience !
I just love the food, best place in Arizona to eat sushi. The staff is so friendly and the service is great.

Some friends asked us here and when we arrived surprised by the location.  Don't be deceived by the location, this place has great quality sushi!  The service was good.  Certainly a place is recommend and go back to over and over again.  Our two favorite options were the Play Girl and jalapeno himachi.  Yum to both!

I remember eating here years ago when they were connected to the Wal-Mart building. It was a tiny place with not much room but it was very good.   After saying a million times that I need to eat there again, my wife and I go for my birthday dinner. When we got there there wasn't much going on so we sat down right away.   Looking at the menu, I see that the large beers are $5, and then I take a look at the little sign on the table. "Sake Bombs $5, includes large beer and sake". SOLD! We both get one, and got WAY more sake then I thought we would, and before I could even get halfway done with my beer, our sushi arrived, it was really fast. I think we got two rolls and pot stickers.   All of the food was really good, the only thing I would change is that the roll sizes are a little large, it takes a really big bite to get a piece in. Not that I'm complaining cause I like my portions, but just a slightly smaller roll would be perfect.   Summary:   YOU DON'T NEED TO GO TO SCOTTSDALE TO EAT GOOD SUSHI!! Support the north side and help the little guys out, you'll be glad you did!
You get what you pay for here, its cheap but there is a reason.  Don't expect to be blown away, but for its price range its good.
Great spot for quick sushi and great service! We ordered the Scorpion roll and Sashimi boat A; both were delicious and very presentable. We will definitely go again!

I was recommended by a friend to come here. We chose sushi from the happy hour menu. The service was very quick and the sushi was delicious. The presentation of the sushi was nice and prepared very well. They got busy quickly. Recommend for families of anyone else that loves sushi!

The happy hour sake bomb special of 5 bucks is only valid if you order 10 bucks worth of food per person. So if you have two people getting two sake bombs you need to have 20 bucks of food between you for the deal, which means you'll spend 30 bucks minimum without tip. We like doing 2 sake bombs and a happy hour roll and a specialty roll.
Sushi did not taste fresh.  And whatever sauce they used on my not-fresh dragon roll almost made me puke.  Service was decent though.  That deserves the one star I am forced to put on here.

Came here for dinner based on the many positive Yelp reviews and I'm sorry to say this was the worst sushi I have ever had.  The portions were TINY and the sushi was, well, fishy. It didn't taste like the high quality sushi that I was expecting.  Plus the prices were extremely high for the quality and quantity of food received.  I guess RA and Kabuki are the only decent sushi restaurants in the Phoenix metro area.  Avoid this place and go to either of those instead!

Excellent Happy Hour prices.  Sushi was fresh, service was fast.  Very busy place, I think the word is out about this place.  I have eaten Sushi at a lot of places here in Phoenix and this place is good.

Ordered our food around 5:30 yesterday. Everyone that came in behind us (even 20, 30 minutes after us) got their food before us. At one point the waitress brought one roll over out of the 6 rolls we ordered. It wasn't even ours. She came by and picked it up off of the table and took it to another table which seemed kind of gross since it was at our table for like 5-10 minutes and we could have licked it for all she knew. Finally our food starts to arrive an hour after we ordered and it was all completely incorrect, soy paper on everything when only two rolls were ordered with soy paper. At that point it wasn't worth sending back because we were starving and it took so long in the first place. They really made no attempts to make it right with us. Sushi was decent. Would never, ever return.

This is my favorite sushi place in town. he happy hour pricing is amazing and the food is really good. My drink never gets below half empty as the servers are always on top of it.   I highly recommend the "What the Heck" roll. Very spicy and so good.

Im a big sushi fan and this past Wed we had to find a place to eat, our friend recommended Tokyo Lobby.   I've driven past it before, but never thought to eat.  The back of the building faces Bell Rd., so you dont actually see anything but the name.  When walking inside, it has the decor and feel like a small well lit sushi bar. They have a patio outside that is covered for small parties and people to hang out at.  Inside they have about 10 or so tables.  Plenty of room for anyone.  We ordered our drinks and some edemame and then it was time to order the sushi..  We tried some of the signature rolls like "Orgasm" and "Monkeybrains."  Let me tell you... some of the best sushi I have had.  The Orgasm was so unusual, but delicious.  It had a sweet crunch to it and then just melted in your mouth.  I know that can sound a bit much.. but it was amazing.  For three people.. we ordered six rolls..Yes.. 6.   When I was done, I was literally thinking "Umm. more please?"  I can't wait to go back!  The service was awesome, the food was great and I had no clue this place was this good!

My hubby and I love this place. The food is always delicious and fresh! Only thing I would recommend, if you go close to opening in the evening, sit outside! They are good about the restaurant being clean but heavy on the pinesol and that ruins the experience, but sit outside and that works great, plus it's very comfy.
Vegas roll and crazy roll are AWESOME. Pretty small place so take that into consideration. Would love to try more on their menu!

Since we have found Tokyo Lobby we have stopped going anywhere else.  Our favorites are Monkey Brains and the Playboy Roll.  The Playboy Roll is one of those rolls that you can't stop thinking about until you get it again.  It is really that good. The restaurant is small but we have never had to wait to get in.   The owner is usually there and very attentive. I highly recommend this place!!

I've been here a few times. I've tried a variety of their rolls and have to say the sushi is just okay. What I keep coming back for is specifically for their Glendale and Volcano rolls which are rich and flavorful.  Their bento boxes were surprisingly good sized.

Oh my god! I can't praise them enough! Never have I had such delicious premium sushi consistently over years. The staff and owners are friendly and quick to bring our order. The menu has grown over the years and so has the location but everything they prepare is fresh , delicious and photo worthy! Writing about it is making me hungry again!! This is a Must if you're a sushi  lover.
Delicious rolls and awesome happy hour deals. Try the Crazy Roll for something out of the box. Ashley is a great server!

One of my favorite sushi restaurants in the valley. The selection of rolls is plentiful and always of the highest quality. The staff is welcoming and attentive. The weekend happy hour is another reason to like this place.

Came here for dinner on a Tuesday night with another couple.  I was excited to come here because this place has been on my list since I moved to Glendale.  The restaurant is located in a boring strip mall, but you would never know that by the looks on the inside.  I had the Las Vegas roll, spicy tuna roll, edamame, and miso soup.  The sushi was great like most others are saying here on yelp.  The miso soup was very delightful and had some good flavor to it.  The only reason I'm giving this place four stars instead of five is the fact that the edamame came out soggy and seemed to be cooked well before I ordered it.  I will definitely try this place again to see if I can bump it up a notch in my opinion.  This place should not be overlooked!

I've enjoyed eating at this restaurant in the past, but I recently ordered pick up and was disappointed. My dad asked for low sodium soy sauce several times, when I opened the bag, there was one small container of regular soy sauce....for enough food to feed three people. The dried calamari was so bland and chewy, almost as if it came from a bargain brand in the frozen section at a grocery store that was put in a microwave.

I don't have a lot to say about this place. Sushi was okay. They put way too much sauce on the rolls and the rolls themselves are monotone in taste. Nothing spectacular, but nothing utterly disgusting at the same time. Would I recommend this place? Probably not. There are better sushi place around the area.

After the first bland meal I had here I swore I would never be back. However a friend had a birthday dinner here recently and so we went back. I stayed away from the strange and flavorless veggie roll that I had last time and this time ordered the  Agedashi Tofu and Vegetable Tempura while my husband ordered Bento box chicken B. The Agedashi Tofu was another flavorless item and the ice cold sauce they provided did little to add flavor. The Vegetable Tempura was the highlight of my meal but when items that are supposed to be hot are served with ice cold sauce it ends up being a strange and unwelcome marriage. My husband's chicken teriyaki also had minimal flavor and it seemed that the teriyaki sauce had been squirted on the accompanying vegetables afterwards as apposed being added to the chicken while cooking. The spicy tuna roll was so slathered in a sauce that my husband described as tasting like thousand island dressing that they were inedible. The best thing on his plate were the spring rolls and they were clearly taken out of a package (not made at the restaurant) and fried. The service also left much to be desired. When one of our party asked a question about a menu item the (older of the working waitresses) waitress replied "I don't know, I'm not eating it.".. So when our checks arrived and we found that our bills had been first added together and then separated as we had originally asked so that the 18% large bill gratuity would be added to each bill I was floored. I am all for tipping big when it is deserved but this service in no way deserved this amount of gratuity. Being a friend's birthday party I just went with it but next time, party or not, I will never be dragged to this poor service and tasteless food restaurant again.
This place is awesome all the way around! super fresh sushi and friendly service,would go here every week if I could.
Always amazing. Great staff. Fun atmosphere. Rolls are well proportioned. The sushi crew is always creating new fun things to try. Recommended to a friend and his wife...they're hooked!

New favorites at Tokyo Lobby:   -Volcano Roll: baked scallops with vegetables on a california roll  -Sex on the Beach: spicy crab and ahi tuna on top of a tempura banana  -Scorpion Roll: shrimp tempura, crab, tuna, whitefish and masago  -Salmon sashimi  I'm now there on a weekly basis. It's becoming a slight obsession...

First off I have to say, when entering this place, I felt so welcomed!.  All the chefs and waitress stop what they are doing to say "Hi" to you. Almost giving you that celebrity feeling. I kept hearing great things about this place and I wanted to give it a try.  The place is a little far from where I am since I reside in Tucson and this is located in North Phoenix area, but heck, it was definitely worth the travels.  I ordered several rolls that sounds delicious. Starting off with a Fiesta Roll, which was labelled as "Very Spicy", I was like lets see how spicy this is! It turns out the spice was pretty hot, definitely hotter than Siracha, which most sushi restaurants uses. I couldn't quite figure out what type of spice it was but it sure did have a kick. At the same time not only was it spicy it was delicious.The spice did not over power the flavor of the salmon and tuna.   My second roll was the Baby Lobster roll which was just a mountain of eyegasm. There were rolls of salmon underneath a delicious sauce called "Dynamite Sauce". Ontop of that there were baby lobster tails sitting in the center. The rolls and the flavor all combined with the dynamite sauce was just amazing. It had a sweet like caramel taste to it.   Just after these two rolls I felt pretty satisfied. Usually I am able to eat more than 2 rolls but they were filling. I will definitely be returning here whenever I'm in the sushi mood and up in Phoenix again. Oh and when you leave, they always all tell you "bye" as well just like you were entering!

I have a friend who has been a long time champion of this place for several years now. He swore to me up and down that it was amazing; so my wife and I made the long journey from south phoenix to glendale to see what this place was all about, and I have to say, I'm happy we did. We tried a wide variety of their rolls, and while I know sushi is typically expensive, this place was well priced for the quality we received. We tried the volcano roll, which was amazing. The combination of flavors was superb, it was a bit much to take in. My only criticism of it would be that it was a little too saucy, but still good. Then we moved onto the jalepno poppers, not sure what they were called, they were delicious! And just the right amount of spice. The las vegas roll was good, exactly what you would expect. The dragon roll, which is just eel on top of a california roll was great. We got a roll that had shrimp tempura in it as well and it was delicious, crunchy on the inside, not soggy like some places you go to.   Overall, I would say this is my favorite sushi place in the valley, with a very close second being Sushi Eye (they're just too expensive, and the quality doesn't justify the price). If you go here, you will love it.

This place came highly recommended by a fellow sushi lover. Unfortunately, my boyfriend doesnt have an appetite for raw meat so I usually have to find a sushi place that also serves other less 'scary' dishes. This place is a  perfect fit.   He ordered their fried rice while I pigged out on eel, ebi, tuna, and albacore (to name a few). The plates were served quickly, and were fresh!   Please dont think that the waitresses are rushing you. They want to make sure you get what you ordered promptly.   I made the mistake of complaining to my sushi going friend that we felt rushed. He mentioned he knew the owners and that the waitresses are trained to serve the plates quickly.   Our glasses were never empty, which is a huge deal for me because I drink ALOT of water at all times.

Authentic sushi in Arizona, loved the spicy yellowtail roll, our friends liked the Vegas roll, and miso soup. 2 couples, total bill 80.00, 40 per couple and this wasn't their happy hour as it starts at 8pm.

For some reason, sushi brings out the snob in Americans. Unfortunately, it has been less of an opportunity to dine on high quality uncooked seafood, and more of a showcasing of who can look trendiest or appear to have the best taste.  When I'm done making fun of newbies who prefer California rolls, and tired of gaudy decorations, I need a place that gets down to business. A place where you can chill out and and stuff some salmon in peace.  Tokyo Lobby is that place.  The traditional rolls are always tasty, and I don't recall any individual item being more than about $10. What really shines here are the specialty rolls. I tried the 'Orgasm' and the flavor blew my mind. I really wanted the Sex on the Beach, but to my dismay the chef was out of the bananas for the tempura. Curses, but you knew I'd be back anyway!  My only problem is that I feel the eel sauce is too sweet...reminded me of an allspice flavor as opposed to the more savory sauces I've sampled elsewhere. Also, the seating is a bit crowded and they're closed on Sunday! That alone has lost them several visits from me. STILL WORTH IT.  Next time you're on Bell Road craving sushi, visit Tokyo Lobby and get a quality product without seeing swarms of snobs. You'll thank me later.

Definitely love the sushi here.  The quality of the rolls is amazing and the amount of rolls on the menu is impressive.  Staff are always on top of your order and there is almost never a wait for a table or the check.  My drink is always full and they are constantly making sure everything is delicious.  This place can get packed during lunch but I've never had to wait for a table, ever.  Highly recommended great sushi!
Amazing Strawberry Nigori Saki! We really enjoy the Las Vegas Roll, the Phoenix Roll and the Mexican Roll. Great service!

I went for lunch, the specials were just okay. There was nothing special about their sushi and the customer service was terrible. We needed to flag the waitresses down just to get a drink refill. I haven't been back and since found much  better sushi places in terms of taste, service, and specials.

You don't understand, this is the GREATEST place ever! No need to look to other reviews! I have never been so surprised of how great the food is and keep coming back when I get a craving for their amazing Mexican roll, or the HOT Vegas roll, and lets not forgrt the delicious, and my personal favorite, Scorpion roll! You can never go wrong here! The best INEXPENSIVE sushi joint ever!

If you're a fan of deep fried sushi this is the place to be! Sadly, I'm not that big of a fan but Tokyo Lobby is good. Unfortunately, I also missed Happy Hour but was looking forward to their  $5 sake bombs (Beer and a bottle of hot sake) that's a pretty damn good deal if you ask me.  Ordered about 3 rolls, vegetable tempura and a large bottle of beer to share with a friend. Every roll we had contained some kind of fried aspect. The vegetable tempura here was actually very good tbh and I found the sushi to be very edible. We managed to finish all of it! The unfortunate fact is that the flavors all seemed to be very similar because they all had tempura bits or fried part to them. Wish I could of tried their items that showcase the freshness of their fish more or their sashimi.  The service here is good and quick. It's pretty dark inside, but definitely more comfortable that how the outdoor seating seemed to be. Price point is typical for not being on happy hour and for the amount of food we got.  Holding Tokyo Lobby to 3 stars because I believe there could be some potential if I were to truly see the quality of their fish and I would definitely love to come back to enjoy their Happy Hour! Until next time TL!

Went here as part of a double birthday celebration for my son and husband.  Once again, the orgasm roll was the hands down favorite.  They have indoor and outdoor seating, so you can enjoy the nice Arizona weather until it gets too hot.  The fish is always fresh and the prices seem to be consistent with other quality sushi places.

My go to sushi place with my best friend. Prices are good, especially if you go during happy hour, staff is friendly, and the food is fresh and tasty! The waiters usually give my friend's little daughter a special treat as we are leaving and her very own pair of kid friendly chopsticks. I've been to many other sushi places and none can really compare to the service and food I get here.

Mom and I hit this place for the tail end of happy hour.  Great choices of happy hour items and beverages.  We pigged out on sushi and appetizers. I had never had real wasabi before and it was served with my sashimi order.    The tempura was good and greasy. Typical selection. Looks like an ok place for quick affordable sushi options.

First time visit and won't be the last.  Ate outside as it was a beautiful spring evening in Phoenix.  Service was great, very friendly and attentive.  Not a sushi fan but wife and I both had Tempura Deluxe with teriyaki chicken.  Miso soup was excellent.  Portions very large, chicken sliced into bite size pieces, vegetable tempura light and not oily.  Dressing on small salad very tasty.  Wound up asking for a Togo box as neither of us could finish the chicken.  Highly recommend.
Yeah...this place is pretty awesome. Excellent, attentive service and great food.   Everything I've ordered has been fresh and tasty.  Not much more to say except, GO THERE! It's good stuff.

I love this place! They are so friendly and offer exceptional, fast service! While the seating is sometimes less than desirable because it can be busy if you're sitting in the middle aisle, the sushi is well worth that! Haven't dined outside yet, but it always looks very nice out there.

As far as it goes, you can't find a better sushi "happy hour" in the valley. And by "happy hour" I mean almost all day every day (exception is Friday and Saturday 5:00 - 8:00 PM). Included in happy hour is a $5.00 Sake Bomb special. How can you beat that?! My husband and I can both get a drink, 2 rolls each and get out of there for $35.00. It is definitely our favorite cheap date place! Not only are the prices great, the food is awesome.   Due to the fact that this place has amazing food/prices/drinks/everything it can get super busy (it's not a very large restaurant) so you may want to call ahead if you are going with a group of 4+. They do have 2 large patio areas that are very pleasant to sit at when the weather is nice  Two thumbs up all around!

I have been here a few times. I really do like this place but I feel as its too small and people are sitting on top of each other but I can't blame them for being busy. I got the baked lobster roll and the lettuce shrimp wrap. Both very good with quality ingredients. I do feel the lettuce wrap was a little over priced for the size. Staff is always nice and attentive. Definitely recommended.

Honestly, the food is all tasteless. The soy sauce has no flavor, the wasabi has no flavor, the rolls have no flavor. I was just really disappointed because it tastes like you're just chewing tempura and rice. Pretty disappointed and probably not coming back. The service however, was great and she was very kind and attentive.
Hands down....our fave!!!  Haven't had anything yet we didn't like. Happy hour is great! Always great, friendly service...and when the weather is pleasant, we like sitting on one of the patios.
Went for happy hour. Great tempura, scorpion roll was to die for. $5 sake bomb, wow. Definitely will be back soon.

I called 1 hour ahead on a Friday night. Got a reservation for 6 on the patio. Beautiful night in Phoenix. Overall, everything was excellent. No problem splitting the checks. The servers were anxious for our group to order. We ordered beers, wine, appetizers. There was a long gap between serving our entrees, but we didn't mind as we all shared tastes. A diverse group. Sushi lovers and non sushi lovers. Everyone seemed to love their food, except the one who ordered chicken fried rice as an entree. He said it was just okay. The rolls were amazing. We ordered several different kinds and enjoyed them all. Soup was good too. Service is matter of fact. Not obsequious, but pretty good. Recommend for affordable, casual night out.

This is the worst sushi in the area. Terrible service and the sushi rolls are small and poor quality. Lunch specials are cheap for a reason. Rice is hard and stale as well as the rolls are tiny and don't have much filling. Under poor ownership or management. Sakana right up the road or even the Fry's on 67th and Bell have way better quality sushi rolls. Don't waste your money here if you are a true sushi lover.

I don't know why I waited almost three years to try Tokyo Lobby. I've driven past it a hundred times and from Bell Road, it doesn't look like much. It's in a Walmart parking lot, next to a Payless, for f*cks sake!  BUT! It's a good thing I decided to blow off existing reservations elsewhere to drop in on a rainy Friday night because I was truly impressed with the rolls, the nigiri, and the udon here.  For a small dining area, they do pack in the tables and it's bigger inside than it looks outside. There are two outdoor patios but I'll be sitting at the sushi bar from now on.   The two chairs in the middle of the bar were all that was available when my lady love and I arrived, so we got seated right away and asked the server to bring us two Kirin sake bombers- the intelligent way to begin any sushi meal on the west side.  I made sure to order a few rolls to try as well as some of my personal favorite nigiri- the tako AKA octupus. One of the best servings of tako I've had in Arizona. It was garnished with super-thinly sliced lemon on each of the two pieces of octopus tentacle and it was so tender and not gristly or rubbery as I've had elsewhere. I immediately asked for another order.  The specialty rolls were really well put together, with lots of fresh fish and interesting combinations of sweet, savory, salty and sour from the various sauces and ingredients. Textures- crunch and bite and melt in your mouth- are well thought out in the various house rolls.  About halfway through dinner, I got to speak some with the sushi chef about the day's special on a sign behind him "blue fin tuna- $5.99 sushi, $14.99 sashimi" and he mentioned that he "only gets the good stuff" from his supplier. Looking at it in his window at the sushi bar, it was that deep red color you hope for in a piece of good tuna and it did not disappoint when he handed it to me on a plate. Garnished with wasabi, he tells us "one bite" and there it goes, no soy sauce, either. Damn good.   I wanted more nigiri and he prepped some flounder and yellowtail belly for us. The texture of the flounder was like butter- owing to the way he sliced the filet and the yellowtail belly was wrapped around some julienned vegetables and herbs and topped with a raw quail egg. Again, he says "one bite" and it was outstanding.   I had to try an udon so I opted for the tempura udon which is accompanied by tempura veggies and a shrimp. I love anything with a complex broth and noodles and I was in love with this bowl of deliciousness. They even brought out some togorashi for me as seasoning.  I've eaten a lot of sushi in a lot of places including Michelin star restaurants in New York and California and I would pull up a chair for an omakase at Tokyo Lobby any time. I don't think there'd be fugu or toro but I know I'd get an incredibly memorable meal.

If your a sushi fan than look no further than this place ESPECIALLY during the week when prices are great fir happy hour! The presentation is quaint with service not being very friendly but is not rude by any means. They will even stand at times waiting for the opportunity to fill your drink asap.

What a treat.  We sure were surprised at the quality of the sushi here.  This is a small joint so come early or be prepared to wait.  The place right off of bell road which was nice and the parking was good.    We went to Tokyo Lobby at around 8pm and lucky for us there was a table open right when we got there.  The hostess sat as after the bus boy/server/bus boy cleaned the table.  It took about ten minutes before we could place our order and it seemed that way because one waitress was taking orders in the entire place.  We also had to ask for her to take our order also.  She seemed a little over whelmed with the amount of tables she had so we said here we go have a little patience.  We ordered all of our food at once knowing that if we ordered drinks and waited to order when the drinks came it would take forever.    Our Sushi was excellent! Very Very Very good and fresh.  The Edamame was so fresh and good and huge portion.  Our beers cold you cant go wrong with kirin!  But my favorite had to be the phoenix roll it was so amazing.  The spicy tuna role was very much the same as most places except they put this awesome sauce on it and it is actually spicy! go figure spicy to a phoenix resident!  Overall I say go and go again! They have bento bowls for those who want a combo but the Sushi A+++++  I would give 5 stars if the service was a little bit better  2 large kirin beers,Edamame,2 miso soups,2 rolls of sushi phoenix and tuna, and 2 sashimi plates with yellowfin tuna and octopus = 61 bucks.  Not too bad!

Me and my husband love Tokyo Lobby! We always receive good service and fresh sushi. I think my favorite thing about Tokyo Lobby is that their non sushi sushi is as great as the rolls with raw fish. My hubby is not a fan of real sushi so this is a place we can both go and enjoy our food. Favs? Monkey Brain (sounds way worse, it is quite tasty). Also the Chicago Roll. Best sushi on the west side for the price you pay. I would much rather give Tokyo Lobby my business than a chain restaurant that wants to charge me double for food and have less quality.

We used to love this place, but during last 2 years it went from very good to very bad place. Everything taste the same no matter which one u order. overpriced, service is become very unpleasant , and we been charged on our c.card almost 3000$ , yes that's right, which was froze our account , and we had to deal with it like an hour over the phone to clear that out with our bank. At the end we didn't get even proper apology not from the server who made that mistake , not from management . Never going there again.
Love their garlic edamame and the spicy teriyaki chicken. Also the spicy crab roll is delish! My kids and I go often and love to sit outside. Also they play 80's music! So awesome!

This place is awesome. We had happy hour and that doesn't mean everything is deep- fried. (Cause that's not sushi). They have fresh ingredients, service was great , food is delicious and they even accommodated my request for no mayo. And great prices. Definitely going back.

My Favorite Sushi places; Always Fresh Sushi. Location; Very easy right off Bell and 59th Ave Restaurant; Cute little place with patio seating, usually sit outside during cooler days Food; By far the best tasting sushi in the Valley, always quick and what we ordered.  Service;  Very quick. Happy Hour prices is PERFECT

This place is the jam... it's extremely difficult to find sushi in the deadly desert that is not only trustworthy but also, expertly crafted and insanely delicious. These guys care about their food and it's easy to see and taste. I live in Old Town Scottsdale and I make it a specific 34+ mile trek to and from Tokyo Lobby because I know I can count on them for quality. They fill up fast so, be mindful of what time you try to get in on certain days. If you gotta wait, just do it.

We used to love this place...two years ago.  Things have changed.  The last two times I've been there...everything was just so so.  They use the same sweet sauce on almost every roll.  My deep fried Ama Ebi heads were soggy.  The garnish for one of my plates was a piece of fake crab cut on an angle.... $100 and everything "tastes the same" to quote my daughter.  So three stars for an MEH dinner.    I'd rather pay the about same & drive across town to get a 5 Star meal at YASU BISTRO in PV.  BEST SUSHI IN TOWN.
I love Tokyo Lobby! Their happy hour is fantastic. The rolls are always fresh and delicious. I love sitting on the patio during the cooler months! ;)
We have been coming this place since the day 1 they open, great place, good food, fresh fish... I'm one island girl knows my seafood !!! This is awesome !

I love that it's happy hour most of the time.  Such a great deal!  Came in one time on a Friday night and there was a loud table having a good time.  We sat at the sushi bar and the sushi chef apologized on their behalf for them being so obnoxious, which I didn't mind since it was the weekend but I thought it was sweet of the sushi chef haha.

My family and I have been going here for years. I come back every time I'm in town. They never have disappointed me!    Excellent rolls. Glendale roll. Vegas roll. Shrimp tempura roll. All the nigiri. Always spot on.   The ika salad here is the best I've ever had.   Service is always friendly and helpful. Such a welcome experience.
Went in on word of mouth. Loved the atmosphere and bar. Everything was wonderful. I wish they had all you can eat.

Best customers service I've ever had, we have had multiple servers come up to our tables asking if we needed anything. The presentation of the food was impressive, and the derive was also fast. I love this place !
Absoloutely LOVE this place. Happy hour all day? Cant beat that! Great sushi, great service and groovy music!
This place never disappoints. Amazing happy hour and all day $5 sake bombers.

I adore Tokyo Lobby. I have been going to TL for years (since they were in a different location across the parking lot), and it's always amazing. I've never had a bad bite. I love spicy mayo (as do I), so I feel like this is my ultimate happy place, but if you are not super into spicy mayo, just know it is used heavily (a super bonus for me). The owners, Kelvin and Jennifer, are fantastic. I honestly love this place.

One of the better places on the West-side, and arguably the best sushi in the valley of the sun.  Like many others have said, most people probably drive by this place a couple times a day and don't think twice about it. It's in a very unassuming strip mall straddling the side of a Payless shoes.  Since the sushi has been covered by just about everyone else,  let me try to expand on some of their other dishes. The miso soup is great and has just the right amount of flavor. Occasionally it can be a bit on the salty side, but that occurrence is rare and shouldn't stop you from giving it a try.
