I've been addicted to Teriyaki dishes since living in Seattle and have to say this is about as good as it gets in Arizona.  The meat is usually tender and not over saturated with sauce. My only qualm would be with the rice. It's actually perfect, but I just wish they gave you more of it.  Overall though it's still one of my favorite places here in the valley. No reason you shouldn't stop by, especially if your on the west side.

I am still on a quest to find decent sushi in the Northwest valley. Came to this restaurant based upon the reviews and was hoping that THIS TIME the reviews would be right. Some thoughts.....  I have tried Sushi all over the world and have a favorite spot in Tucson I compare everything to, Sachiko Sushi. At Tokyo Lobby the fish was decent (yellow tail, tuna, and salmon) but a little on the small side and maybe a bit overpriced. I am surprised at how much more sushi is here compared to Tucson. I figured it would be as cheap if not cheaper due to more competition...oh well.  Had two rolls, a California and a Spicy Yellow Tail. Let me start with the California roll. This seemed to have mayo in it. I have found this to be the norm up here. I don't get that...mayo adds nothing except maybe to reduce the restaurants cost. Don't get me wrong, I like mayo just not in my California roll. The Spicy Yellow Tail tasted good but seemed small.   We rounded out the meal with Edamame and a Dinner salad. My wife said the Dinner salad was the best plate she had in the whole meal. I think that pretty much sums it up.   Total cost $32 without drinks. I think in Tucson I would have paid about $20. Oh well my quest continues.

Came here on my last day of a trip to Phoenix, and was surprisingly blown away! What I thought would just be some random Japanese place for dinner ended up not only being great, but also a great value! We ordered mostly from the happy hour menu, which was 5PM-9PM Monday-Friday, which gave us a bunch of rolls, and even tempura for ~$5.   The d√©cor and staff here are also great and you really feel like you're eating at a much more upscale restaurant than the cost would have you think. Will definitely come by again for a meal when I'm around the area.

I LOVE sushi! And I love it even more when it is from Tokyo Lobby.  I eat here at least once a week, budget be damned.  I can't help it. I'm addicted.  I probably need some kind of support group. I'm all about the soft shell crab and the blue fin. I am also a big fan of their bento boxes.  You get a lot for your buck.  And for appetizers, the Heart Attack is great (never in a million years would I have thought I would be paying for a heart attack).  I usually go as they are opening, because once lunch hour hits, an available seat will be impossible. You should really give this place a try, it is a real treat.

The sushi here is pretty good for Az. We like the orgasm roll quite a lot. They have a Midwestern discount with i.d. which is nice. We have also never had a bad experience with the sashimi. Worth a try for sure.

I have been there few times. My favorite  is the baby lobster roll, it is fantastic, you should try it. The food is overpriced, you could end up paying $35 or more for lunch per person. They used to give Miso soup with every order, now they charge for it.

I think this is maybe 4.2 Stars. Good Sushi, CLEAN place.  Turnover?    I ventured to Tokyo Lobby based on good YELP reviews. It is in a nice strip mall in Glendale with plenty of parking, a nice patio, clean clear windows and signage.   Greeted quickly when we walked in and quickly seated at the sushi bar.    The place is clean.  The have GOLD STARS from the Health Department and it shows.  Yes, I check.  Regularly.  They have a good record and it shows.  The bathroom was clean too, no issues.  Not bad for late on a Friday night.  Sushi:  I am a fairly experienced sushi person. I found the sushi to be fresh, well cut and tasty.  Seared Albacore with scallions - YUM. Fresh Salmon - YUM. Also had tasty Uni, A very nice Albacore Sashimi Presentation and some other yummy stuff including a surprise Jalapeno Popper type thing.  THE PROBLEM?? Starter salad - Dressing good, Lettuce Old (wilted).  Somewhat hard to communicate with the sushi chef because the sushi bar seats are low and it is a little noisy.    The regular clients are probably more into simple sushi (rolls) than fine sushi / sashimi.  Our patricular sushi chef was very experienced, and very creative.  However he made it clear that he has worked at better sushi bars in is life, and was soon moving out of town.    NOTE to PROfessionals of all types:  ALWAYS be a pro.   You are "on-stage" at all times.  Be a PRO or go home.  For a small local spot, I was impressed.

How is does this place not have 5 stars?  Moving here from the Bay Area i was so afraid to try sushi.  I stumbled across this place with a friend after 6-7 months of living here.  I have not eaten sushi anywhere else for the last 7 years.  It is seriously that good!  Favorite rolls, Playboy, Mexican and Scorpion.  If you feel like splurging go for the baby lobster.  Its DELICIOUS!

Definitely a five star sushi place. I have had sushi in many different sushi restaurants around Arizona but this one takes the cake!  The happy hour specials here are great and make good sushi affordable. The staff is also very friendly and you can tell they care about your experience at the restaurant. The chefs do a great job and the setting makes it feel authentic. I take my girlfriend here a lot and with the affordable specials they have, along with the good quality of the sushi, we might just become regulars.
Loving coming here!! The food is so good and the staff are always on their feet. Great prices too
Simply one of the best Sushi Bars in Phoenix, very good service!! I would brag about how fresh the food is but then more people would go and make it harder to get in !!!

Everytime I come here I always get a warm greeting the second I walk in the door. I always thought the sushi was great but I don't really eat at any other sushi places. Well I finally had sushi somewhere else and instantly regretted it. Freshness was nothing compared to how it is here at toyko lobby. You can tell everyone here really works hard and take time in little details to make this such a great restraunt. Keep up the good work guys! I'll definitely be back soon!

This is one of my (and my son's) favorite spot for lunch. Food is absolutely delicious and fresh. Very clean dining room and friendly staff. When ever we have to be in that part of town we make sure to stop in for a meal.

Pretty good rolls and miso! Music and service is good Stopped for lunch my gyoza was good but overcooked. I got a beef teriyaki bento it came swimming in sauce still good after wiped the excess off All in all a better experience than most

This sushi bar is my absolute favorite! I will literally drive from Prescott (about a two hour drive) just to eat here. The atmosphere is very mellow; love the '80s jams! I also love how everyone is greeted as they enter the restaurant.  I've never had a roll I haven't liked here. I have to admit, I haven't tried much else of their menu other than sushi. But from what I've tasted, everything here is delicious. And their tempura rolls are always delicious without being oily. They're very accommodating here as well. I once went in when I was pregnant and they made some very good recommendations based on my restricted diet. Keep up the great work Tokyo Lobby!

My family and I went to eat here last night, they welcomed us in which was cool, they took our drink order as soon as we sat down which was nice. We weren't quite ready to order when they brought us our drinks and after that it took like 10 mins for them to come back to take our order... Then when our food arrived it was wrong we had to flag someone down and when they came they got an attitude that it wasn't correct. We waited forever before someone came to refill our drinks, they come and go so quick you can't even get a word in. We waited 15 mins for our bill and another 10 to get our card and receipts back! It was in all fairness busy however that doesn't entitle them to ignore tables or rush in and out without asking if everything was ok. The food was good but not great... Nothing to shout about IMO. I was more disgusted by the rudeness and the lack of giving a crap on how they treated their customers! I had been here before during lunch and it was always good this was the first time I had been in there for dinner and sadly the last time I will ever be back! Customer Service is so important! You pay yes for the food but also for great service and perhaps it was just a bad night for them...  But honestly they were too busy running around and not being careful, we witnessed them dumping a tray of drinks on a female customer, the table next to us also had the wrong order.... So bad night indeed.

Favorite local sushi place.   Get there early or be prepared to wait as it gets packed quickly and people tend to order lots of items. Fish has always been very fresh and they have some different and tasty rolls. Service is attentive Pricing is right on target for the quality.
This place is awesome great service fresh sushi and made right as you order it fabulous choices great place to eat and I waitress Ashley was awesome we will go back again
We both had the Bento boxes. Teryaki Chicken was very tasty. Great tempura and yummy California rolls. Great service, too. We highly recommend this place. They also have Full sushi bar.
